text: Imre Farkas (23 June 1935 - 10 August 2020) was a Hungarian sprint canoer. He competed in the late 1950s and early 1960s. He competed in two Summer Olympics. He won two bronze medals, earning one in 1956 and one in 1960. Farkas died on 10 August 2020 at the age of 85.Imre Farkas' obituary ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Hungary Category:Canoeists
title: Imre Farkas (canoeist)
